item.title: Mexico Moves Closer To Putting A Tax On Violent Video Games
item.content:encoded:
Mexico’s government has moved another step closer to putting a tax on video games it deems to be violent. On Friday, Mexico’s Chamber of Deputies approved a financial package that includes an 8% tax on violent video games.

According to the proposal, the tax would apply to games rated “C” and “D” under the Mexican System of Equivalences of Video Game Content Classification. When comparing to the ESRB, a “C” rating is for players 18+ while a “D” rating is for games rated for “Adults Only”.

Back when it was first proposed in early September, the claim was that “recent studies have found a relationship between the use of violent video games and higher levels of aggression among adolescents, as well as negative social and psychological effects such as isolation and anxiety.” This was said without providing any examples of those studies.

This new tax would apply to all games, both physical and digital. For free-to-play titles, the 8% tax would apply to in-game purchases and microtransactions.

The bill hasn’t become law in the country yet, as it will now head to the Mexican Senate for debate. Should it continue to move forward and become law, games from popular series like Grand Theft Auto, Mortal Kombat, and others will be subject to this new tax.

What do you think about taxing violent video games? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about 2K hiring a new studio head at 31st Union to lead development on Project Ethos. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Sucker Punch Comments on Possible Ghost of Yotei DLC
item.content:encoded:
A recent interview with Sucker Punch reveals that Ghost of Yotei DLC is possible, but only if necessary.

Released earlier this October, Ghost of Yotei serves as a spiritual sequel to 2020’s Ghost of Tsushima. Following mercenary Atsu, she travels around Edo to get revenge on those who killed her family. The game, a PlayStation 5 exclusive, is one of 2025’s best-reviewed titles alongside Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and Death Stranding 2: On The Beach. Now, with the game all wrapped up, Game Informer chatted with key members of the development team about what may be next for Atsu, if anything.

Ghost of Yotei DLC Possible If Fans Want One, Says Sucker Punch

In a recent interview with Game Informer, Ghost of Yotei co-director Jason Connell and lead writer Ian Miles talked about the game’s success and story. While the article itself is full of spoilers, it did come with some good news for fans. When asked about possible DLC, Connell remarked,

“I think for us, we are at the spot in the project where we just get to put it out there and see what’s resonating with people and what people love and what people feel like they wish they maybe knew more about Atsu,” says Connell to Game Informer. “And I think for us, this is like the most important part of the project, in terms of making decisions like these, because same thing with Tsushima. You can listen, you can be like, ‘Oh, okay. People seem to want to know a little bit more about that relationship or what happened to the dad.’

Connell, in the quote, refers to Ghost of Tsushima’s Iki Island DLC, which launched with the game’s Director’s Cut in 2021. The story in the expansion revolved around Jin’s father, someone who wasn’t explored much in the main game. He continues,

“How do you further that character?” states Connell. “And you get this rare opportunity to actually listen to millions of people about what resonated within a story versus maybe what didn’t or what are the holes. And I think that’s the mode that you want to be in. And that’s sort of the gift. Certainly we love Atsu, and we think it’s a great character. And just like with Jin, if there’s rooms to improve it or to bring some new elements to life or clarity for the narrative’s sake and it falls within what is best for Sucker Punch, then we’ll certainly take a hard look at that for sure.”

Without going into spoilers for Yotei, there are sure to be some paths that potential DLC can take. While the developers do state that they view Atsu’s story as complete, it’s not out of the picture yet. Given the success the title has had this year, perhaps we may return to Edo in the near future.

Would you like to see DLC for Ghost of Yotei? Did you enjoy the title? Do you prefer Yotei over Tsushima? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Ghost of Yotei, check out our articles on the Legends mode and what’s next for Sucker Punch. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter for more Insider Gaming!

item.title: Sony Files Injunction to Bar Tencent from Using Any Resemblance to Horizon’s Aloy
item.content:encoded:
A new update on the lawsuit reveals that Sony has filed a motion for a preliminary injunction to stop Tencent from using Aloy’s resemblance and other elements from the Horizon series.

Sony Interactive Entertainment has filed a case against Tencent for copyright and trademark infringement in a California federal court. The company has already called the accused’s upcoming title a “blatant knock-off” after their motion to dismiss. Now, Sony is seeking an injunction.

Sony Wants to Hold a Hearing Next Month

According to a report by Games Fray, Sony is seeking a preliminary injunction in the Horizon clone lawsuit against Tencent. The motion is to stop Tencent “from reproducing, preparing derivative works of, displaying, performing, and distributing any works copied or derived from SIE’s Horizon Works, including Light of Motiram, and from using the ALOY Character Mark or any confusingly similar mark pending trial.”

Coming to what the Aloy Character Mark is, “she is a young and fierce tribal warrior huntress characterized by fiery red hair, high cheekbones, and outfits that blend tribal and industrial metallic elements.” The injunction also seeks to stop Tencent from using visual, audio, and storyline elements from the Horizon series.

Sony has asked Judge Jacqueline Scott Corley, from the FTC v. Microsoft-Activision Blizzard case, to hold a hearing by November 20, 2025. The company wants a decision by the end of that month or in December. Sony has also added several sworn declarations along with the personal injunction, which includes statements from Guerrilla Games Studio and Art Director Jan-Bart van Beek, the studio’s music lead Lucas van Tol, PlayStation Productions head Asad Qizilbash, and Sony brand IP director Matthew Kuykendall.

In other news, Horizon Zero Dawn movie plans to start shooting in 2026 and is targeting a 2027 release. Additionally, Tencent had responded to Sony’s copyright and trademark infringement lawsuit with a motion to dismiss. What are your thoughts on Sony seeking a preliminary injunction? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about a new Dragon Ball game being announced during the franchise’s 40th anniversary in January 2026. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Plants vs Brainrots Codes (October 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Plants vs. Brainrots pays homage to the classic Plants vs. Zombies tower defence title. In this Roblox experience, instead of fighting zombies with plants, you’ll battle waves of Brainrots, collect them, and place the best ones on platforms to generate passive income. However, to defeat and obtain Limited, Secret, Godly, and Mythic Brainrots, you’ll need the help of the active Plants vs. Brainrots codes.

These Roblox codes can be redeemed for free Gears, Potions, and Money, which in turn will help you expand your garden, purchase new platforms, and fill your Index with every Brainrot and Plant available. Become the richest defender on the map by redeeming the featured active codes below.

Active Plants vs Brainrots Codes 

Inactive Plants vs Brainrots Codes 

There are no inactive codes for Plants Vs Brainrots. This is a good thing, as you can expect future active codes to stay valid for a longer time. However, to stay on the safe side, you are advised to redeem all the active codes before they expire randomly.

Steps To Redeem Plants vs Brainrots Codes 

  1. Launch Plants Vs Brainrots and connect to the map. 
  2. Press the Shop icon on the left side of the screen. 
  3. Select Rewards and press Codes to open the code box. 
  4. Enter the code into the Type Code Here text box. 
  5. Click the Claim button to redeem the active code in Plants Vs Brainrots

More About Plants vs Brainrots Codes

Purchase Gears and Plants using the free Money redeemed from the codes. Plants differ in DPS, and the costlier it is, the more damage it does.

Here are all the Plants with their price list: 

Cactus Seed – $200 

Strawberry Seed – $1,250

Pumpkin Seed – $5,000

Sunflower Seed – $25,000

Dragon Fruit Seed – $100,000

Eggplant Seed – $250,000

Watermelon Seed – $1m 

Grape Seed – $2.5m

Cocotank Seed – $5m 

Carnivorous Plant Seed – $25m 

Mr Carrot Seed – $50m

Tomatrlo Seed – $125m 

Shroombino Seed – $200m 

Mango Seed – $367m 

King Limone Seed – $450m 

All Gears and their use in Plants Vs Brainrots: 

Water Bucket – Splash on Plants to make them grow 25% faster – $7,500

Frost Grenade – Throw to stun Brainrots – $12,500

Banana Gun – Shoot Brainrots to damage them (100 DMG) – $25,000

Frost Blower –  Freeze Brainrots and slow them by 50% – $125,000 

Carrot Launcher – Shoot Brainrots to damage them or players to fling them (500 DMG) – $500,000 

FAQs On Plants vs Brainrots Codes

Where can you find more Plants vs Brainrots codes?

The best way to find more codes is through the game’s official Discord server.

What are the latest codes in Plants Vs Brainrots?

STACKS and frozen are the latest Plants Vs Brainrots codes. 

Can you redeem free Brainrots from the active Plants Vs Brainrots codes?

As of now, none of the codes can be redeemed for Brainrots and Plants. 

When are new codes for Plants Vs Brainrots released?

The active codes for Plants Vs Brainrots are out during special events and big updates.

Are you a big fan of Jump and Splash? Then be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can start up some new light-fingered discussions.

While you’re getting stuck into Roblox, check out our code guides for other games, such as Steal an Anime, Steal a Brainrot, and Steal a Star Wars.
